Q3.1_1: These questions relate to legal constraints connected to data sharing. - I am not allowed to share my research data
Q3.2: Why are you not allowed to share your research data?
Q5.1_1: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I do not wish to answer questions about my data coming from secondary researchers who aren't experts in the field
Q5.1_2: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - Preparing data to make it suitable for online sharing is too time consuming for me
Q5.1_3: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - It is unfair for other researchers to profit from my hard work; they should collect their own data
Q5.1_4: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - My data set is too big to share
Q5.1_5: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - My data set is too complex to share
Q5.1_6: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - My data is not important enough to share
Q5.1_7: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I am afraid that I will not get proper recognition for sharing my data, in the form of a footnote
Q5.1_8: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I am afraid that I will not get proper recognition for sharing my data, in the form of a citation
Q5.1_9: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I am afraid that I will not get proper recognition for sharing my data, in the form of co-authorship
Q5.1_10: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I have never learned to share my research data online
Q5.1_11: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - Online sharing of research data is not a common practice in my field
Q5.1_12: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I plan to commercialize my data or technology
Q5.1_13: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I prefer to share my data sets upon request
Q5.1_14: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - There is no suitable place to share my research data, e.g. the repository does not have enough capacity
Q5.1_15: These statements relate to possible barriers for data sharing. - I have never thought about sharing my research data online
Q5.2: List as many online data repositories you can think of:
Q6.1_1: These questions relate to other researchers' fears with regard to data sharing. - I think that other researchers are afraid that by sharing their data, they lose control over their intellectual property
Q6.1_2: These questions relate to other researchers' fears with regard to data sharing. - I think that other researchers are afraid that alternative analyses will be performed on their data and that it will be argued that their conclusions are invalid
Q6.1_3: These questions relate to other researchers' fears with regard to data sharing. - I think that other researchers are afraid that errors will be discovered in their data
Q6.1_4: These questions relate to other researchers' fears with regard to data sharing. - I think that other researchers are afraid of being scooped; that others may publish results from their data set before they are able to
Q6.1_5: These questions relate to other researchers' fears with regard to data sharing. - I think that other researchers are afraid a secondary user will misinterpret their data
Q6.1_6: These questions relate to other researchers' fears with regard to data sharing. - I think that other researchers are afraid that a secondary user will use their data for unintended purposes
Q7.1_1: These questions relate to potential fears with regard to data sharing. - I feel that by sharing my data I lose control over my intellectual property
Q7.1_2: These questions relate to potential fears with regard to data sharing. - I am afraid that other researchers will perform alternative analyses on my data and argue that my conclusions are invalid
Q7.1_3: These questions relate to potential fears with regard to data sharing. - I am afraid that other researchers will discover errors in my data
Q7.1_4: These questions relate to potential fears with regard to data sharing. - I am afraid of being scooped: that other researchers may publish results from my data set before I can
Q7.1_5: These questions relate to potential fears with regard to data sharing. - I am afraid that a secondary user will misinterpret my data
Q7.1_6: These questions relate to potential fears with regard to data sharing. - I am afraid that a secondary user will use my data for unintended purposes
Q8.1_1: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... minimal effort is required to share
Q8.1_2: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... minimal time is required to share
Q8.1_3: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... the data will be easily understood by secondary researchers
Q8.1_4: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... you would get recognition for the data with a footnote
Q8.1_5: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... you would get recognition for the data with a citation.
Q8.1_6: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... you would get recognition for the data with a co- authorship.

Q8.1_9: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... there was a suitable place to share your research data
Q8.1_10: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... you had the first rights to publish the results from the data
Q8.1_11: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... you or your group trust the requestor of the data
Q8.1_12: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 1/2) - ... for each individual request, you can determine the conditions of sharing

Q9.1_6: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 2/2) - ... your institution encourages you to share

Q9.1_9: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 2/2) - ... your research grants would be increased if you shared
Q9.1_10: How likely you are you to share your research data if ... ? (part 2/2) - ... your research grants would be decreased if you did not share your data
Q10.1_1: These questions relate to your general opinion about the practice of data sharing. - How desirable do you think data sharing is for your research field?

Q10.4: What do you think is the best way to promote data sharing?

Q10.4: Fully accessible data sharing can be really tricky, I'm a big fan of "data available on request", as a way of promoting accessibility without it being "out there" in the public domain with no boundaries.
